column4: I have insetalled Ubuntu on a Unibody MacBook Pro, and all is well, except that the keyboard layout isn't correct. For one thing I can't find curly/square brackets, and | and ' are swapped.
you just need to use xmodmap.  fixing those things is really simple when it's just single keys or shifted keys
so if mostly everything is correct, I should just fix one by one until I'm good?
yeah I think that's your best bet.  Hopefully you don't have a lot of keys to remap but it's not hard to do.  You can just google xmodmap and find a few tutorials and examples of similar issues
